lang::Profile Class Reference
[Language support library]

#include <Profile.h>

List of all members.

Detailed Description

Performance profiling is important part of any game development.

Profile is a light-weight and high resolution performance profiling class.

Usage example: {verbatim}

void myFunc() { PROFILE(myFunc); ... }

main() { Profile::beginFrame(); for ( int i = 0 ; i < 100000 ; ++i ) myFunc(); Profile::endFrame();

for ( int i = 0 ; i < Profile::count() ; ++i ) printf( "%s: x%d, %g%%\n", Profile::getName(i), Profile::getCount(i), Profile::getPercent(i) ); } {verbatim}

Member Enumeration Documentation

anonymous enum
 

Enumeration values:
MAX_BLOCKS  Maximum number of profiled blocks.
MAX_NAME  Maximum name length for a block (keep short to avoid overhead).

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

const char *  sz
)  [inline]
 

Begins profiling a single block.

Do not use this method directly, but use PROFILE macro instead.

Exception If high resolution timer not available.

Member Function Documentation

void lang::Profile::beginFrame (   )  [static]
 

Begins a time frame.

Frame is used to report back percentages which each block took. All blocks share the same time frame.

int lang::Profile::blocks (   )  [static]
 

Returns number of profiled blocks.
